title: 108_hr3478
content: The National Archives and Records Administration Efficiency Act of 2004 extends records retention periods and allows the use of a revolving fund for uniforms for records center employees. Subsection (a) of the records center revolving fund in title IV of the Independent Agencies Appropriations Act, 2000 is amended to include expenses for uniforms or allowances as authorized by subchapter I of chapter 59 of title 5. The amendment allows for charging fees for occasional, non-official use of rooms and spaces in National Archives buildings. Fees collected will be deposited into the National Archives Trust Fund. The National Archives Trust Fund will be used for the benefit of national archival and records activities, including educational and public programs. SEC. 5. AUTHORITY TO USE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS WITH STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND OTHER PUBLIC AND NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO FURTHER NARA PROGRAMS. This section adds a new authority for cooperative agreements with various entities to support NARA programs. The Archivist is authorized to enter into cooperative agreements transferring funds to support National Archives programs, with a limit of $25,000 per agreement and $75,000 per fiscal year. The Archivist must submit a report to the Committee on Government Reform by December 31st each year. The Archivist must submit a report to the Committee on Government Reform and the Committee on Governmental Affairs regarding cooperative agreements entered into during the previous fiscal year. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the chapter. SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations through fiscal year 2009 for National Historical Publications and Records Commission. Amends Section 2504(f)(1) of title 44, United States Code to allocate $10,000,000 for fiscal years 2006-2009.
